frontmatter.title: Dynamic Angular components inside custom widgets
frontmatter.summary: Learn how and why you want to use dynamic Angular components inside your custom widgets.

frontmatter.title: Advanced caching with RxJS
frontmatter.summary: When building web applications, performance should always be a top priority. One very efficient way to optimize the performance of our applications and improve the experience of our site is to use caching mechanisms. In this post we'll develop an advanced caching mechanism with RxJS and the tools provided by Angular to cache application data.

frontmatter.title: Custom Overlays with Angular's CDK - Part 2
frontmatter.summary: In this follow-up post we demonstrate how to use Angular's CDK to build a custom overlay that looks and feels much like the Google Drive file preview overlay. We'll pick up from where we left off and implement keyboard support, image preloading and add animations in order to make our overlay more engaging.

frontmatter.title: Custom Overlays with Angular's CDK
frontmatter.summary: The Angular Material CDK provides us with tools to build awesome and high-quality Angular components without adopting the Material Design visual language. Its goal is to make our life as developers easier and extract common behaviors and patterns shared between multiple Angular Material components. In this post, we'll use the CDK to build a custom overlay that looks and feels much like the Google Drive file preview overlay.

frontmatter.title: Easy Dialogs with Angular Material
frontmatter.summary: Building modals and dialogs isn't easy - if we do it ourselves. Angular Material comes with a powerful dialog service that makes it very easy to create custom dialogs in our own applications. Let's take a look!

frontmatter.title: A web animations deep dive with Angular
frontmatter.summary: Angular comes with a built-in animation system that lets us create powerful animations based on the Web Animations API. In this article we'll look at two differet approaches, namely imperative and declarative animations.

frontmatter.title: Custom themes with Angular Material
frontmatter.summary: Angular Material offers great theming capabilities for both, built-in and custom themes. In this article we'll explore how to make your custom components theme aware!

frontmatter.title: Angular Master Class - Redux and ngrx
frontmatter.summary: Today we're super excited to announce that we finished working on our new Angular Master Class courseware. Read on for more information!

frontmatter.title: Three things you didn't know about the AsyncPipe
frontmatter.summary: This article explains three lesser known features of the AsyncPipe that help us to write better async code.

frontmatter.title: Using Zones in Angular for better performance
frontmatter.summary: In this article we'll take a look at how to use Zone APIs to improve our app's performance!

frontmatter.title: Making your Angular apps fast
frontmatter.summary: In this article we discuss tips and tricks to make Angular blazingly fast!

frontmatter.title: A revamped Angular Master Class
frontmatter.summary: We're announcing our brand new Angular Master Class courseware including Angular Material and Angular Flex Layout!

frontmatter.title: Testing Angular Directives with Custom Matchers
frontmatter.summary: Deliver terse, DRY, self-documenting unit tests with Angular using custom Jasmine Matchers and  Helper functions.

frontmatter.title: Testing Services with Http in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Want to learn how to test services in Angular that have an Http dependency? Read more here!

frontmatter.title: Two-way Data Binding in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Two-way data binding was one of the main selling points of AngularJS. Since Angular, we can build directives that implement two-way data binding. This article explains how!

frontmatter.title: Resolving route data in Angular
frontmatter.summary: We often want to make sure that certain data is available before a component is instantiated via routing. In this article you'll learn how to resolve route data.

frontmatter.title: Angular Animations - Foundation Concepts
frontmatter.summary: Animation in Angular is now easy and more intuitive... Learn foundational animation concepts and start animating your Angular components!

frontmatter.title: Angular 2 is out - Get started here
frontmatter.summary: Yes. The day has come. Angular 2 is finally released and here's how to get started.

frontmatter.title: Bypassing Providers in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Dependencies are provided from the nearest ancestor provider in the injector tree. This article shows how to bypass it.

frontmatter.title: Custom Form Controls in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Angular makes it very easy to create custom form controls. Read on to learn how to do it!

frontmatter.title: Protecting Routes using Guards in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Angular's router enables protecting routes using guards and in this article we're going to discuss how to implement them.

frontmatter.title: Reactive Forms in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Angular allows us to build forms in a model-driven fashion. In this article we're going to discuss what that looks like.

frontmatter.title: Cold vs Hot Observables
frontmatter.summary: In this article we are going to demystify what the term hot vs cold means when it comes to Observables.

frontmatter.title: Routing in Angular revisited
frontmatter.summary: Learn how to implement basic routing in your Angular application using the latest and greatest APIs!

frontmatter.title: Component-Relative Paths in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Component-relative enable developers to more easily create maintainable, reusable, portable components in Angular. Here's how!

frontmatter.title: How to prevent name collisions in Angular providers
frontmatter.summary: Angular provides a mechanism to avoid name collisions in provider tokens. In this article we're going to explore how opaque tokens make this possible.

frontmatter.title: Exploring Rx Operators: map
frontmatter.summary: This is the first article that is part of a new series where we take a look at different operators of the Reactive Extensions for JavaScript.

frontmatter.title: Angular Providers using Map Literals
frontmatter.summary: Angular has a shorter syntax for creating providers. In this article we're going to take a look at how to create them using map literals.

frontmatter.title: Template-driven Forms in Angular
frontmatter.summary: In this article we discuss the template-driven forms in Angular and all the directives that come into play.

frontmatter.title: Custom Validators in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Often, we need to add custom validation capabilities to our application's form. In this article we're going to explore how to implement custom validators.

frontmatter.title: Angular Change Detection Explained
frontmatter.summary: Wonder how change detection in Angular works?  This article is a write-up of that talk and discusses change detection and tricks to make is super fast.

frontmatter.title: Zones in Angular
frontmatter.summary: In this article we're going to discuss what role Zones play in the Angular platform, with the Angular specific NgZone.

frontmatter.title: Understanding Zones
frontmatter.summary: Since version 2.x Angular takes advantage of a feature called Zones. Learn here what they are and how they work.

frontmatter.title: Taking advantage of Observables in Angular 2 - Part 2
frontmatter.summary: This is a follow up article that demonstrates how Observables can influence our API design.

frontmatter.title: Taking advantage of Observables in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Since version 2.x Angular favors Observables over Promises when it comes to async.  In this article we explore some practical advantages for server communication.

frontmatter.title: ngMessageFormat - Angular's unheard feature
frontmatter.summary: Angular 1.5 is pretty much around the corner. It turns out that there's a feature that already landed in Angular 1.4, that no one really noticed. Curious?

frontmatter.title: Multiple Transclusion and named Slots
frontmatter.summary: One of those bigger features in the 1.5 release is multiple transclusion via named slots. In this article we're going to discuss what it's all about.

frontmatter.title: Upgrading Angular apps using ngUpgrade
frontmatter.summary: In this article you'll learn how to upgrade your Angular 1 applications to Angular 2 using ngUpgrade.

frontmatter.title: Understanding @Injectable in Angular
frontmatter.summary: We might run into unexpected behaviour when injecting service dependencies. This article details how to do it right.

frontmatter.title: Forward references in Angular
frontmatter.summary: In this article we like to explore forward references. Why they exist and how we can use them.

frontmatter.title: Host and Visibility in Angular's Dependency Injection
frontmatter.summary: Angular's DI allows us to configure the visbility of what gets injected from where. Learn about @Host in this article!

frontmatter.title: Angular Template Syntax Demystified - Part 1
frontmatter.summary: Angular 2 introduces it's own kind of template syntax in order to implement different binding strategies. Learn why it's there and how it works.

frontmatter.title: Service vs Factory - Once and for all
frontmatter.summary: This is yet another article on services vs factories in AngularJS. It explains once and for all, why we mostly want to use service.

frontmatter.title: Even better ES5 code for Angular
frontmatter.summary: Nobody prevents us from writing Angular code in ES5. In this article we take a look at a new, much better, syntax to write Angular in ES5.

frontmatter.title: View Encapsulation in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Angular Shadow DOM for styles and DOM encapsulation. This article explores Angular 2's view encapsulation and how we can use it.

frontmatter.title: Taking Angular Master Class to the next level
frontmatter.summary: We always collect feedback to make our material and trainings even better. We listened. Here's what we did.

frontmatter.title: Styling Angular components
frontmatter.summary: In this article we are going to explore the different possible ways of styling Angular 2 components.

frontmatter.title: Routing in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Learn how to route between components. In this article we explore how to use the new router in Angular.

frontmatter.title: Dependency Injection in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Angular implements a very powerful dependency injection system that makes reusing services easy and flexible. Learn how it works!

frontmatter.title: Writing Angular code in ES5
frontmatter.summary: Ever wondered what it's like to write Angular 2 in ES5? Check out this article!

frontmatter.title: The difference between Annotations and Decorators
frontmatter.summary: Learn how AtScript annotations differ from TypeScript decorators in this article.

frontmatter.title: Developing a tabs component in Angular
frontmatter.summary: This article details how to build a simple, but widely used type of component in Angular: tabs.

frontmatter.title: Developing a zippy component in Angular
frontmatter.summary: Just recently we've built a simple zippy component in Angular 2.0.0 and in this article we want to show how. Read on to build your first component.

frontmatter.title: Angular and i18n - The new world
frontmatter.summary: Want to internationalize your Angular app? This articles explains the plans for i18n in Angular 2.0.0!
